stories.text: Looking into focus oriented desktop environment for GNU/Linux, something minimalistic like Sway but easer to use, that let user use the mouse, similar to much easier to install MNM Reform environment (see https://twitter.com/mntmn/status/1406573765643939840/photo/1)
stories.title: Ask HN: Focus Oriented Desktop Environment?
As the Use of AI Spreads, Congress Looks to Rein It In

stories.text:
I use Safari 14 on a MacBook Pro. Recently, I decided to try using private windows exclusively. I really like the experience so far. Cookies, caches, and other site-specific data disappear as soon as I close the tab or window. Yes, I now need to login every time I visit a site that requires it -- no big deal, the built-in password manager in Safari makes that easy. I also lose the browsing history for that window, but if I think I will return to a website I simply create a bookmark.

Do other browsers offer the same feature?
stories.title: Ask HN: Do all browsers support private browsing?
The SolarWinds Hackers Used an iOS Flaw to Compromise iPhones
